skill.name: skill-auditor
skill.description: Audits and validates skill definitions for quality, completeness, and best practices. Use when reviewing existing skills for proper formatting, evaluating if skills should be split into sub-skills, or ensuring skills follow established conventions.
skill.summary: Audits and validates skill definitions for quality, completeness, and best practices. Use when revie...
skill.author: BarisSozen

security_audit.summary: This skill audits other skills by reading SKILL.md files in user-specified directories. It parses YAML frontmatter, validates structure, counts words and TODOs, and produces quality scores. No network access, no code execution, no sensitive data access. Capabilities match stated purpose exactly.

content.value_statement: Skills often have formatting issues or structural problems that reduce their effectiveness. This skill provides automated validation with scoring rubrics to ensure all skills meet quality standards before distribution.
actual_capabilities: Validates YAML frontmatter with required name and description fields
Checks for required sections: When to Use and Workflow
Counts word count and detects TODO placeholders
Scores skills from 0-10 based on quality criteria
Identifies skills that should be decomposed into sub-skills
Generates JSON or human-readable audit reports
limitations: Does not execute or test skill functionality
Does not validate bundled scripts or code quality
Requires skills directory path to be specified manually

use_cases.title: Validate before publishing
use_cases.description: Run audits on your skills to catch formatting issues and improve quality before sharing with others.

use_cases.title: Bulk skill verification
use_cases.description: Check all skills in a repository for compliance with established conventions and quality standards.

use_cases.title: Enforce standards
use_cases.description: Use scoring rubrics to ensure submitted skills meet minimum quality thresholds before acceptance.

prompt_templates.title: Quick audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Use skill-auditor to audit the skill at .claude/skills/my-skill/ and show the quality score.

prompt_templates.title: Bulk audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Run skill-auditor on the entire .claude/skills/ directory and output results as JSON.

prompt_templates.title: Auto-fix mode
prompt_templates.prompt: Use skill-auditor with the --fix flag to auto-correct formatting issues in all skills.

prompt_templates.title: Detailed report
prompt_templates.prompt: Audit all skills and identify which ones should be split into sub-skills based on decomposition criteria.

output: ‚úì Frontmatter present with name and description

best_practices: Run audits before publishing skills to catch issues early
Address warnings about missing sections or high word counts
Use decomposition analysis to identify when to split skills
anti_patterns: Publishing skills without validating structure first
Ignoring warnings about TODO placeholders in descriptions
Keeping skills with word counts exceeding 5000 words

faq.question: Which file formats does this audit support?
faq.answer: Only SKILL.md files with YAML frontmatter in the .claude/skills/ directory structure.

faq.question: What is the maximum word count before warnings appear?
faq.answer: Warnings start at 3000 words; scores are deducted at 5000 words.

faq.question: Can I integrate this into CI/CD pipelines?
faq.answer: Yes, use --json flag for machine-readable output and check exit codes for pass/fail.

faq.question: Does this skill send data to external servers?
faq.answer: No network calls are made. All analysis happens locally on your machine.

faq.question: Why did my skill score below 5?
faq.answer: Critical issues like missing SKILL.md, frontmatter, or name/description fields cause large deductions.

faq.question: How is this different from manual code review?
faq.answer: This provides automated, consistent checks for formatting and structure. Manual review is still needed for content quality.
